intro: Cluytiandra capillariformis, commonly known as the silky flax or silky senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features slender, hair-covered stems and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the seeds are enclosed in slender, hairy pods. Cluytiandra capillariformis is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
